frame.name: Cause_to_be_dry
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Dryee</fen> (either a surface or an entire entity, inside and out) to become dry. This should not include examples like "drying tears" or "drying spills" as these are in the Removing frame.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Michael</fex> <t>dried</t> <fex name="Dryee">the clothes</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Abby</fex> <t>dried</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Dryee">the room</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with a dehumidifier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the intentional act causing the <fen>Dryee</fen> to become dry. <ex><fex name="Agent"> Michael</fex> <t>dehydrated</t> <fex name="Dryee">the apples</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Abby</fex> <t>dried</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Dryee">the room</fex> <fex name ="Instrument">with a dehumidifier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dryee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Dryee</fen> is the entity which has the water removed from it. <ex><fex name="Agent">Michael</fex> <t>dehydrated</t> <fex name="Dryee">the apples</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Abby</fex> <t>dried</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Dryee">the room</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with a dehumidifier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Abby</fex> <t>dried</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Dryee">the room</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with a dehumidifier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an the <fen>Agent</fen> dries the <fen>Dryee</fen>.</def-root >

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen> and what the <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to accomplish.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of dryness. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s. <ex><fex name ="Cause">The wind</fex> <t>dried</t> <fex name = "Dryee">the porch</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The cloth was <t>dried</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the length of <fen>Time</fen> that the drying takes.</def-root>

FE.name: Temperature
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Temperature</fen> at which heat is applied to the <fen>Dryee</fen>.
<ex>He <t>dried</t> the apples in the oven for a day <fex name="Temp">at 350 degrees</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Dryee</fen> ends up dry.
<ex>First, the remains should be <fex name="Degr">completely</fex> <t>desiccated</t> before you begin the extraction.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: dry.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become or cause to become dry.

lexUnit.name: dry out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: a material becomes or cause a material to become dry

lexUnit.name: dry off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: the surface of something/ somebody become or cause the surface of soemthing /somebody to become dry

lexUnit.name: dry up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause liquid to become dry

lexUnit.name: desiccation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of removing moisture from (the air or a gas)

lexUnit.name: dehumidification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of removing moisture from (the air or a gas)

lexUnit.name: dehydrate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to lose a large amount of water
